alert.note: Alert for Le Sueur; Scott; Sibley (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 19 at 9:25PM CDT until further notice by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Minnesota... South Fork Crow River at Delano affecting Wright and Hennepin Counties. Mississippi River at Fridley abv 37th Ave NE affecting Anoka and Hennepin Counties. Snake River At Mora affecting Kanabec County. Mississippi River at St. Cloud affecting Wright, Sherburne and Stearns Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota and Wisconsin... Minnesota River near Jordan affecting Scott, Sibley and Carver Counties. Minnesota River at Savage affecting Scott, Dakota, Hennepin and Carver Counties. Minnesota River At New Ulm affecting Blue Earth, Brown and Nicollet Counties. Minnesota River at Granite Falls HWY 212 affecting Yellow Medicine, Renville and Chippewa Counties. Minnesota River at Montevideo affecting Yellow Medicine, Chippewa and Lac qui Parle Counties. Minnesota River At Morton affecting Renville and Redwood Counties. Minnesota River at Henderson MN19 affecting Scott, Le Sueur and Sibley Counties. Sauk River at St. Cloud affecting Stearns County. South Fork Crow River below Mayer affecting Carver County. Crow River at Rockford affecting Wright and Hennepin Counties. Mississippi River at Red Wing L/D 3 affecting Dakota, Goodhue and Pierce Counties. Mississippi River at Red Wing affecting Goodhue and Pierce Counties. Mississippi River at St. Paul affecting Ramsey, Washington and Dakota Counties. Mississippi River near Hastings L/D 2 (COE) affecting Washington, Dakota, Goodhue and Pierce Counties. Mississippi River At Hwy 169 at Champlin affecting Anoka and Hennepin Counties. Mississippi River AT Hwy 610 @ Brooklyn Pk affecting Anoka and Hennepin Counties. St Croix River at Stillwater affecting Washington, St. Croix and Pierce Counties. Chippewa River at Durand affecting Buffalo, Dunn and Pepin Counties. Rum River near St. Francis affecting Anoka County. .Widespread flooding continues on area rivers. Up to an inch and a half of additional rainfall through Friday morning is expected to prolong high river flows into next week. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE THURSDAY NIGHT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Minnesota River at Henderson MN19. * WHEN...From late Thursday night until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 733.7 feet, The floodwall gates will be closed when Henderson reaches 733.7 and the river is still rising at Mankato. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 830 PM CDT Wednesday, the stage was 731.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Friday morning and continue rising to a crest of 733.2 feet early Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 732.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 733.0 feet on 09/27/2016. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
